title: Recipe for Disaster/Quick guide

properties.name: description
properties.value:
Items required: An eye of newt, a Greenman's ale, a rotten tomato and a dirty blast (ashes added to a fruit blast).
Skills required: 10 Cooking.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Recipe for Disaster/Quick guide
 This quick guide has an in-depth guide here.
It contains a more detailed description of dialogue, cutscenes, and storyline.
The wiki defaults to the British convention for floor numbering: Ground floor, first floor, etc. This may be changed by clicking the moon icon at the top right of the site.

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Speak to the Cook in Lumbridge Castle.
Official difficultySpecial
DescriptionThe cook in Lumbridge has a surprisingly small number of ingredients on hand in his kitchen, possibly as a result of an endless stream of newcomers with light fingers, taking anything that isn't nailed down from his kitchen.

Luckily, in the past, a kind Cook's Assistant was willing to help him in his culinary duties, but a problem has now appeared that could spell... a Recipe For Disaster!

Almost all members may attempt to solve his tricky predicament, and be rewarded accordingly, but only the very elite of Questers will be able to put an end to his problem permanently!
Official lengthVery Long
Requirements

To start the quest and finish the first chapter:

  • 10 Cooking (boostable)
  • Completion of Cook's Assistant

To complete all chapters of the quest:

  • All prerequisite quest requirements
  • 175 Quest points (9 are earned for the other parts of the quest, and 79 are gained by completing all required quests)
  • 70 Cooking (boostable)
  • 48 Agility (not boostable)
  • 50 Mining (boostable)
  • 53 Fishing (boostable)
  • 53 Thieving (not boostable)
  • 25 Herblore (boostable)
  • 59 Magic (boostable)
  • 40 Smithing (boostable)
  • 50 Firemaking (unknown)
  • 40 Ranged (not boostable)
  • 40 Crafting (unknown)
  • 10 Fletching (unknown)
  • 36 Woodcutting (unknown)
  • The ability to defeat high leveled monsters, several of which have to be defeated without using Prayer
  • Completion (or partial completion where stated) of the following quests:
    • Fishing Contest
    • Goblin Diplomacy
    • Big Chompy Bird Hunting
    • Murder Mystery
    • Nature Spirit
      • Priest in Peril
      • The Restless Ghost
    • Witch's House
    • Gertrude's Cat
    • Shadow of the Storm
      • Demon Slayer
      • The Golem
    • Started Legends' Quest up until gaining access to the Kharazi Jungle
      • Family Crest
      • Heroes' Quest
        • Shield of Arrav
        • Lost City
        • Merlin's Crystal
        • Dragon Slayer I
      • Shilo Village
        • Jungle Potion
          • Druidic Ritual
      • Underground Pass
        • Biohazard
          • Plague City
    • Monkey Madness I
      • The Grand Tree
      • Tree Gnome Village
    • Desert Treasure
      • The Dig Site
      • The Tourist Trap
      • Temple of Ikov
      • Waterfall Quest
      • Troll Stronghold
        • Death Plateau
    • Horror from the Deep
      • Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl
Items required

To start the quest and finish the first chapter:

  • Eye of newt
  • Greenman's ale
  • Rotten tomato
  • Any fruit blast excluding a premade fr' blast
  • Ashes

To complete all chapters of the quest:

  • About 320 coins (or 120 if you have the activated Ring of charos)
  • Bowl of water (an empty bowl can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
  • Bucket of water (an empty bucket can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
  • 3 buckets of milk (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
  • 2 eggs (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
  • Orange
  • Banana (obtainable during the quest)
  • Any dye except red, yellow, or orange
  • Spice or gnome spice (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
  • Gloves (ice gloves are preferred)
  • Charcoal
  • Fishing bait
  • Fishbowl
  • 2 bread
  • Pestle and mortar
  • Needle
  • 3 bronze wires
  • Cake tin (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
  • 4 Asgarnian ale (6 recommended)
  • Any cat except an overgrown cat (you'll be chasing rats, so a wily cat is recommended)
  • Several bowls of stew (9 at most)
  • Raw chompy (several recommended in case of burning)
  • Raw chicken
  • Raw cod
  • Iron spit
  • Regular logs
  • Tinderbox
  • Ball of wool
  • Ogre bellows (obtainable during the quest)
  • Ogre bow and several ogre arrows (10 is enough)
  • 2 pots of flour (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
  • Pot of cornflour (or raw sweetcorn and an empty pot)
  • Pot of cream (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
  • Any axe
  • Any pickaxe
  • Any machete
  • Knife
  • Dramen staff and branch
  • M'speak amulet
  • Gorilla, ninja and zombie greegree (or 3000 coins and combat equipment if making the greegrees during the quest)
  • Monkey nuts (or 3 coins)
  • Rope
Enemies to defeat
  • Icefiend (level 13) (only if you lack ice gloves)
  • 5 Mudskippers (level 30/31)
  • Crab (level 21/23)
  • Evil Chicken (level varies) (see below)
  • Black dragon (level 227)
  • Big Snake (level 84)
  • Zombie monkey (levels 82/129)
  • Monkey guard (level 167)
  • Ninja monkey (level 86)
  • Agrith-Na-Na (Level 146)
  • Flambeed (level 149)
  • Karamel (level 136)
  • Dessourt (level 121)
  • Gelatinnoth Mother (level 130)
  • Culinaromancer (level 75)

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Starting out[edit | edit source]

Items required: An eye of newt, a Greenman's ale, a rotten tomato and a dirty blast (ashes added to a fruit blast).
Skills required: 10 Cooking.

  • Speak to the Lumbridge Cook. ( 1•1•1•1)…
    1Do you have any other quests for me?
    1Angry! It makes me angry!
    1What seems to be the problem?
    1YES
  • Speak to him again with items in inventory. ( 1)…
    1
  • Enter the door behind the Cook and watch the cutscene.

Note: Many cooking related item requirements can now be bought from the Culinaromancer's chest.

Subquests[edit | edit source]

The following may be completed in any order and unlock a tier of Culinaromancer's gloves equal to the amount of subquests completed

Items required: 316 coins, a bucket of milk, a pot of flour, an egg, a bowl of water, gloves (ice gloves recommended), 4 Asgarnian ales.
Completion of Fishing Contest.
Recommended: 1 teleport to Camelot and 1 to Falador.

  • Inspect the dwarf.
  • Go to the Rising Sun Inn in Falador and talk to Emily or Kaylee. Pay her (Ring of Charos (a) persuades her for free) to learn how to make Asgoldian ale. ( 2•2)…
    2What can you tell me about dwarves and ale?
    2I could offer you some in return, how about 200 gold?
  • Use coins on your Asgarnian ales.
  • Go to the tunnel under White Wolf Mountain.
  • Talk to "An old Dwarf" (Rohak) and give him Asgoldian ales until he agrees to make a dwarven rock cake.
  • Talk to him 3 times and he will place a dwarven rock cake on the table. (His name will change to Rohak)
  • If you have ice gloves, equip them and pick up the cake. Otherwise pick up the cake with regular gloves then kill an icefiend (at Ice Mountain) to cool the cake. If you forgot to use the ice gloves, you can drop the cake, equip your ice gloves, and pick the cake back up to cool it.
  • Give the dwarven rock cake to the dwarf in Lumbridge.

Subquest complete!

  • 1 Quest point
  • 1,000 Slayer experience
  • 1,000 Cooking experience
  • (Further) access to the Culinaromancer's Chest.

Items required: Bread, an orange, a knife, dye (blue, green, or purple dye), spice/gnome spice, fishing bait, a bucket of water, and charcoal.
Completion of Goblin Diplomacy.

  • Inspect one of the goblin generals.
  • Go to the Goblin Village and climb down the ladder in the north-east building.
  • Talk to the Goblin Cook (Mudknuckles). ( 2•1)…
    2I need your help...
    1What do you need? Maybe I cam get it for you.
    , then talk to him again and give him the charcoal. ( 1)…
    1I've got the charcoal you were after.
  • Talk to the Goblin Cook again. ( 3)…
    3I need your help...
    • Slice an orange and add blue, green, or purple dye.
    • Use spice on a fishing bait.
    • Use a bucket of water on bread.
  • Talk to the Goblin Cook again. ( 3)…
    3I've got the ingredients we need...
  • Give the slop of compromise to the generals in Lumbridge.

Subquest complete!

  • 1 Quest point
  • 1,000 Cooking experience
  • 1,000 Farming experience
  • 1,000 Crafting experience
  • (Further) access to the Culinaromancer's Chest.

Items required: A weapon/food if low level, pestle and mortar, a raw cod, a knife, a fishbowl, a needle, 3 bronze wire and bread.

  • Inspect Pirate Pete.
  • Talk to the cook in the next room about protecting the pirate. ( 3)…
    3Protecting the Pirate
  • Go through all 5 chat options. ( 1•1•2•3•4)…
    1Where do I get Ground Cod?
    1Where do I get Ground Kelp?
    2Where do I get Ground Giant Crab Meat?3
    3Where do I get Breadcrumbs?
    4What do I do with all of it?
  • Use your pestle and mortar on the raw cod.
  • Use your knife on the bread and make breadcrumbs.
  • Talk to Murphy in Port Khazard. ( 1)…
    1Talk about Recipe for Disaster.
  • Talk to Murphy again. ( 1)…
    1Yes, Let's go diving.

Note: Before diving your weight must be under 27 kg and you must have at least 7 free inventory spaces. You also cannot go underwater with a pet following you or in your inventory. You may also wish to acquire multiple ingredients in case the fishcake is burnt.

  • Equip your fishbowl helmet and diving apparatus, agree to go diving.( 1•1)…
    1Talk about Recipe for Disaster.
    1Yes, Let's go diving.
  • Pick some kelp.
  • Go north and talk to Nung.
  • Go west and pick up 5 rocks, then enter the cave.
  • Kill 5 mudskippers (level 30/31) for 5 hides.
  • Talk to Nung twice.
  • Enter the crab pen, kill at least one crab and take its meat (acquire multiple in case the fishcake is burnt).
  • Use your pestle and mortar to grind the kelp and crab meat.
  • Talk to the Cook in Lumbridge about freeing the pirate again. ( 3)…
    3Protecting the Pirate
  • Use the ingredients (ground cod, breadcrumbs, ground kelp and ground crab meat) on each other then cook the fishcake.
  • Give the fishcake to Pirate Pete in Lumbridge.

Subquest complete!

  • 1 Quest point
  • 1,000 Cooking experience
  • 1,000 Crafting experience
  • 1,000 Fishing experience
  • 1,000 Smithing experience
  • The ability to go diving and fight crabs (you need your diving apparatus)
  • The ability to cook crab meat (heals 10 hitpoints in 5 bites)
  • The ability to kill crabs to get their shells and claws, which can be made into a helmet and gloves with a chisel
  • (Further) access to the Culinaromancer's Chest

Items required: A bucket of milk, an egg, a pot of flour, a cake tin.
Completion of Big Chompy Bird Hunting, Priest in Peril, Biohazard, Demon Slayer, Nature Spirit, The Restless Ghost, Witch's House, and Murder Mystery.

  • Inspect the Lumbridge Guide. ( 1)…
    1Yes, I'm sure I can make a cake.
  • Talk to Wizard Traiborn on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Wizards' Tower. ( 1)…
    1Ask about helping the Lumbridge Guide.
  • Talk to him again to enchant the egg by identifying 3 mystery NPCs. ( 1•1)…
    1Ask about helping the Lumbridge Guide.
    1Ok. Let's start!
    • Man with ponytail and book - Reldo
    • Ghostly green woman - Velorina
    • Man with desert robes and white beard - Ali Morrisane
    • Elf - Islwyn
    • Man with purple shirt - Unferth
    • Man with brown vest - Professor Gronigen
    • Woman with pink top - Gertrude
    • Woman (green witch) - Hetty
    • Man (hooded) - Pirate Pete
    • Man with a crown - King Lathas
  • Talk to him again to enchant the milk by answering trivia. ( 1•1)…
    1Ask about helping the Lumbridge Guide.
    1Ok. I'm ready!
    • Defence requirements to wear a Mystic hat - 20
    • Ingredients in a cake - Flour, egg, milk
    • Combat level of Goblins near Lumbridge - 2
    • GP to bribe an Al Kharid gate guard - 10
    • What doesn't lie between Morytania and Asgarnia - Keep Le Faye
    • Gold ring is to 5 as a holy symbol is to - 16
    • Glass vial is to 33 as a glass orb is to - 46
    • Guild closest to Fishing Platform - Legends'
    • Bar west of Pollnivneach - Bandit Camp
    • The River Salve runs from - North to south
    • I can hear howling in one direction and buzzing in the other—where am I? - Catherby
    • If I'm going to need glass, first I will need - Sand, bucket, soda ash, glassblowing pipe
    • Which tower is closest to the Crafting Guild - Dark Wizards' Tower
    • Take the number of fire runes required to cast Fire Strike, and multiply by the number of air runes used to cast Wind Strike before adding the number of earth runes used to cast Earth Wave - 10
  • Talk to him a third time to enchant the flour with a memory test. ( 1•1)…
    1Ask about helping the Lumbridge Guide.
    1Quiz me!
  • Take a screenshot of the items and then close the interface via the X button to answer the questions.
  • Do not use the ESC key to close the interface as it will reset that portion of the test!
    • Which item began with the letter 'm'? - Mind Talisman
    • Which of the following items were NOT shown to you? - Trout
    • How many weapons were you shown? - Three (Maple Longbow, Magic Shortbow and Black Longsword)
    • How many types of rune were there? - Two (Fire Rune and Chaos Rune)
    • Which items were amongst those you were shown? - Book of balance (noted as Guthix Prayer Book,) Magic Logs, Pike
  • Use one of the ingredients on the cake tin, then cook the raw cake.
  • Give the cake of guidance to the Lumbridge guide.

Subquest complete!

  • 1 Quest point
  • 2,500 Cooking experience
  • 2,500 Magic experience
  • (Further) access to the Culinaromancer's Chest

Items required: A cat or wily cat, 10+ stews.
Completion of Shadow of the Storm.

  • Inspect Evil Dave
  • Talk to Evil Dave in Edgeville (down the trapdoor). ( 3•4)…
    3What did you eat at the secret council meeting?
    4You've got to tell me because the magic requires it!
  • Talk to Doris upstairs.
  • Use your cat to catch hell-rats (right-click chase on your cat). Using a fully grown cat is much more efficient, but using a kitten still works.
  • Collect spices from hell-rats. There are 4 spices to collect: yellow, orange, red, brown. Collect at least 3 doses of each.
  • Now find the perfectly spiced stew with the right quantity of all 4 colours of spice.
    • Figure it out one colour at a time by adding different quantities of a colour and giving the stew to Evil Dave. When he says "…I think you've got the amount of one spice right…" you know the correct dose for that spice (be sure to finish the dialogue with Dave, otherwise you will not be able to give him the stew in Lumbridge).
    • Start by adding 1 dose of a colour to a stew, and if that isn't right add 2 doses of that colour to a stew; if 1 or 2 doses are not right, you know 3 doses is the correct dose for that colour.
  • Give Evil Dave the completed stew, then give him that spicy stew in Lumbridge.

Subquest complete!

  • 1 Quest point
  • 7,000 Cooking experience
  • The ability to catch hellrats to get a Hellcat
  • The ability to have your cat fight Hell-Rat Behemoths
  • The ability to add coloured spices to stew by catching hellrats (Spicy stews can boost and lower certain stats)
  • (Further) access to the Culinaromancer's Chest

Items required: Any log, any axe, ball of wool, any pickaxe, 1+ raw chompy, an iron spit, a tinderbox, ogre bellows and an ogre bow with ogre arrows.
Completion of Big Chompy Bird Hunting, 20 Firemaking and 41 Cooking.

  • Inspect Skrach Uglogwee. ( 1•2)…
    1Yes, I'm sure I can get some Jubbly Chompy.
    2Oh Ok then, I guess I'll talk to Rantz.
  • Talk to Rantz ( 2•3)…
    2I'm trying to free Skrach, can you help?
    3Ok, I'll do it.
    . (You can use the fairy ring code AKS and run east)
  • Go south-east and talk to Rantz by the coast. ( 2)…
    2Ok, here I am...I guess this is the watery place? What now?
  • Use your woodcutting axe on the fallen tree twice.
  • Talk to him again. ( 2)…
    2Ok, the boat's ready, now tell me how to get a Jubbly?
  • Get some raw chompies if needed.
  • Go to Karamja and find the tree with an arrow in it (small tree on the coast, just south of transportation icon west of Tai Bwo Wannai).
    • You can use the fairy ring code CKR and run north along the coast to the west to find it
  • Light a fire next to the tree, use your iron spit on a raw chompy, then cook it.
  • Board the ogre boat. ( 1)…
    1
  • Talk to Rantz south-east near the coast. ( 2)…
    2Ok, now tell me how to get Jubbly!
  • Collect a bloated toad from the nearby swamp.
  • Make sure your ogre bellow has at least 1 charge remaining
  • Get a rock from the mine by Rantz' cave.
  • Use the ogre bellows on the bloated toad for a balloon toad.
  • Drop the balloon toad and kill the Jubbly with ogre arrows. You may have to attempt multiple times.
  • Cook the Jubbly on Rantz's spit-roast.
  • Give the Cooked jubbly to Skrach Uglogwee in Lumbridge.

Subquest complete!

  • 1 Quest point
  • 1,500 Woodcutting experience
  • 1,500 Cooking experience
  • 1,500 Crafting experience
  • 1,500 Ranged experience
  • The ability to use the boat trip to travel between Karamja and the Feldip Hills (you must pay a fee of chompies or exotic herbs)
  • (Further) access to the Culinaromancer's Chest

Items required: A bucket of milk, pot of cream, a pot of cornflour (or an empty pot and a raw sweetcorn), a vanilla pod (obtainable during Legends' Quest), a dramen branch, a dramen staff, a pestle and mortar, ice gloves, a raw chicken, combat equipment to kill a Black dragon and the Evil Chicken.
Completion of Lost City and started Legends' Quest.

  • Inspect Sir Amik.
  • Ask the cook how you helped Sir Amik Varze. ( 4•5•2)…
    4More...
    5More...
    2Protecting Sir Amik Varze
  • Use milk on cream.
  • If you need a pot of cornflour, grind raw sweetcorn in a windmill and fill a pot with it.
  • Add the pot of cornflour to the milky mixture.
  • Pick a vanilla pod in the Kharazi Jungle (SW of the pool used in Legends' Quest), add it to the cornflour mixture.
  • Talk to the Wise Old Man in Draynor, ask about strange beasts, then the Evil Chicken. ( 3•2•5•2)…
    3I'd just like to ask you something.
    2Strange beasts
    5The Evil Chicken
    2
    Make sure you finish the dialogue or you will not be able to proceed.
 This fight takes place in an instanced area.
On death, all unprotected items will be moved to a grave outside the instance. Any items left on the ground will be lost.
  • Use a raw chicken on the Evil Chicken shrine in northern Zanaris (where you arrive from the swamp.)
  • Run north past the dragons and kill the Evil Chicken, pick up its egg and add it to the brulee.
  • Kill a black dragon, there is a safespot to the east, pick up the dragon token.
  • Grind a dramen branch with a pestle and mortar to make cinnamon, add it to the brulee.
  • Return to Zanaris through the southern portal.
  • Equip ice gloves then rub the token. ( 1)…
    1Please flambe this creme brulee for me.
  • Give the Brulee supreme to Sir Amik in Lumbridge.

Subquest complete!

  • 1 Quest point
  • 4,000 Cooking experience
  • 4,000 Hitpoints experience
  • Access to the Evil Chicken's Lair, where you can fight black dragons (The fowl beast himself has moved on to other things.)
  • (Further) access to the Culinaromancer's Chest

Items required: M'speak amulet, ninja, gorilla and zombie greegrees, 3010+ coins, rope, a knife, a pestle and mortar, a banana (obtainable on Ape Atoll), monkey nuts (obtainable on Ape Atoll), combat equipment (ranged weapon if you need to kill a Monkey Guard), and 3-9 free inventory spaces.
Completion of Monkey Madness I, 48 Agility, 70 Cooking.
Recommended: An Antipoison.

  • Inspect Awowogei.
  • Travel to Ape Atoll, equip a monkey greegree and M'speak amulet.
  • Talk to Awowogei south of the temple.
  • If you need a banana and monkey nuts, buy them from the food store now.
  • Talk to any of the 3 monkeys in the north-west corner of the temple. ( 3)…
    3Do you know anything about the King's favourite dish?
  • Use your Banana and Monkey nuts on any of them. (Ensure you use both your Banana and Monkey nuts on them or else the Tchiki nuts will not appear on the bush.)
  • If you already have a gorilla, ninja, and zombie monkey greegree then skip this part.
    • Buy 3 blank monkey talismans from the rune store.
    • Kill a monkey archer in the market and take its bones.
    • Kill a Monkey Guard in the temple and take its bones.
    • Kill a zombie monkey under the temple and take its bones.
    • Bring the bones and talismans to Zooknock at the end of the Ape Atoll Dungeon.
  • Note: You should take at least 3 snake corpses, red bananas, and tchiki nuts in case you burn the stuffed snake (use the drop trick for the nuts and the banana).
  • Travel to Crash Island and climb down the pit. Kill some level 84 big snakes for their corpses. (Recommended to pray melee before descending into the pit)
  • Return to Ape Atoll and find the red banana tree north-west of the big gate (by the shore).
  • Equip your gorilla greegree and use a rope on the tree to get some red bananas.
  • Equip your ninja greegree and enter the Ape Atoll agility course.
  • After swinging the rope, enter the hole and pick some tchiki nuts.
  • Grind the tchiki nuts, slice the red banana, and add them to the snake corpses.
  • Equip your zombie greegree and enter the temple dungeon.
  • Go down one of the ramps and enter the crack in the wall between the two ramps.
  • Lay your stuffed snake on the rock to cook it (requires 70 cooking).
  • Give the cooked stuffed snake to Awowogei in Lumbridge.

Subquest complete!

  • 1 Quest point
  • 10,000 Cooking experience
  • 10,000 Agility experience
  • Ape Atoll Teleport spell
  • (Further) access to the Culinaromancer's Chest

The final battles[edit | edit source]

 This fight takes place in an instanced area.
On death, all unprotected items will be moved to a grave outside the instance. Any items left on the ground will be lost.
  • You will need 175 Quest Points and complete Desert Treasure before entering the portal.
  • Remember, you can bank between every kill. Enter the portal and defeat without prayers:
    • Agrith-Na-Na – Range or melee it, wear dragonhide.
    • Flambeed – Mage him with water spells + snare. He can unequip your weapon, unless you are wearing ice gloves.
    • Karamel – Mage her with fire while within melee distance or melee with crush. She will lower your stats frequently. Bring at least 2 restore potions. Or if going melee, use super combat potions
    • Dessourt – Mage (air spells or Iban blast) or range him. Snare will help.
    • Gelatinnoth Mother – Bring runes for all 4 elemental spells, a melee weapon, and a ranged weapon. Aim for high range defence without sacrificing too much magic attack.
    • Culinaromancer – Attack with whatever you can hit hardest with. Most of his damage comes from a magic attack that hits at a flat 1-in-3 rate, so your magic defence is irrelevant.

Quest complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

In total, completing all 10 subquests for "Recipe for Disaster" awards:

  • 10 Quest points
  • An experience lamp, which grants 20,000 experience to any skill above 50 (can be banked for later use)
  • Access to the following areas:
    • Mogre Camp
    • Evil Chicken's Lair
  • Ability to dive for crabs
  • Ability to cook crab meat
  • Ability to catch Hell-Rats
  • Ability to own a hellcat
  • Ability to add coloured spices to stews of any sort
  • Ability to use the boat trip to travel between Karamja and Feldip Hills
  • Ape Atoll Teleport spell
  • Full access to Culinaromancer's Chest
    • Access to Kitchen weaponry
    • Access to the banking chest (under Lumbridge Castle)
    • Access to a food store in the Chest
    • Access to buy Barrows Gloves
v • d • e
Recipe for Disaster
Subquests
  • Another Cook's Quest
  • Freeing the Goblin generals
  • Freeing the Mountain Dwarf
  • Freeing Evil Dave
  • Freeing the Lumbridge Guide
  • Freeing Pirate Pete
  • Freeing Skrach Uglogwee
  • Freeing Sir Amik Varze
  • Freeing King Awowogei
Monsters
  • Agrith-Na-Na
  • Flambeed
  • Karamel
  • Dessourt
  • Gelatinnoth Mother
  • Culinaromancer
Rewards
  • Antique lamp
Related
  • Culinaromancer's Chest
  • Quick Guide
  • Full Guide
rawContent:
{{External|rs}} {{Quick Guide}} {{Floor}} ==Details== {{Quest details page|Recipe for Disaster}} ==Walkthrough== ===Starting out=== ''Items required: An [[eye of newt]], a [[Greenman's ale]], a [[rotten tomato]] and a [[dirty blast]] (ashes added to a [[fruit blast]]).''
''Skills required: 10 [[Cooking]].'' {{Checklist| *Speak to the Lumbridge [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]]. {{Chat option|1Do you have any other quests for me?|1Angry! It makes me angry!|1What seems to be the problem?|1YES}} *Speak to him again with items in inventory. {{Chat option|1}} *Enter the door behind the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]] and watch the cutscene. }} '''''Note:''' Many cooking related item requirements can now be bought from the Culinaromancer's chest.'' ===Subquests=== The following may be completed in any order and unlock a tier of [[Culinaromancer's gloves]] equal to the amount of subquests completed |-| Dwarf= ''Items required: 316 [[coins]], a [[bucket of milk]], a [[pot of flour]], an [[egg]], a [[bowl of water]], gloves ([[ice gloves]] recommended), 4 [[Asgarnian ale|Asgarnian ales]]. ''
''Completion of [[Fishing Contest]]. ''
''Recommended: 1 [[Camelot teleport (tablet)|teleport to Camelot]] and 1 [[Falador teleport (tablet)|to Falador]].'' {{Checklist| *Inspect the dwarf. *Go to the [[Rising Sun Inn]] in [[Falador]] and talk to [[Emily]] or [[Kaylee]]. Pay her ([[Ring of Charos (a)]] persuades her for free) to learn how to make [[Asgoldian ale]]. {{Chat option|2What can you tell me about dwarves and ale?|2I could offer you some in return, how about 200 gold?}} *Use coins on your Asgarnian ales. *Go to the tunnel under White Wolf Mountain. *Talk to "[[An old Dwarf]]" (Rohak) and give him Asgoldian ales until he agrees to make a dwarven rock cake. *Talk to him 3 times and he will place a dwarven rock cake on the table. (His name will change to Rohak) *If you have ice gloves, equip them and pick up the cake. Otherwise pick up the cake with regular gloves then kill an [[icefiend]] (at [[Ice Mountain]]) to cool the cake. If you forgot to use the ice gloves, you can drop the cake, equip your ice gloves, and pick the cake back up to cool it. *Give the dwarven rock cake to the dwarf in Lumbridge. }} ''Subquest complete!'' [[File:Recipe for Disaster (Freeing the Mountain Dwarf) reward scroll.png|centre]] *{{SCP|Quest|1}} [[Quest point]] *{{SCP|Slayer|1,000}} [[Slayer]] experience *{{SCP|Cooking|1,000}} [[Cooking]] experience *(Further) access to the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]]. |-| Goblin generals= ''Items required: [[Bread]], an [[orange]], a [[knife]], [[dye]] ([[Blue dye|blue]], [[Green dye|green]], or [[Purple dye|purple]] dye), [[spice]]/[[gnome spice]], [[fishing bait]], a [[bucket of water]], and [[charcoal]]. ''
''Completion of [[Goblin Diplomacy]].'' {{Checklist| *Inspect one of the goblin generals. *Go to the [[Goblin Village]] and climb down the ladder in the north-east building. *Talk to the [[Goblin Cook]] (Mudknuckles). {{Chat option|2I need your help...|1What do you need? Maybe I cam get it for you.}}, then talk to him again and give him the charcoal. {{Chat option|1I've got the charcoal you were after.}} *Talk to the Goblin Cook again. {{Chat option|3I need your help...}} **Slice an orange and add blue, green, or purple dye. **Use spice on a fishing bait. **Use a bucket of water on bread. *Talk to the Goblin Cook again. {{Chat option|3I've got the ingredients we need...}} *Give the slop of compromise to the generals in Lumbridge. }} ''Subquest complete!'' [[File:Recipe for Disaster (Freeing the Goblin generals) reward scroll.png|centre]] *{{SCP|Quest|1}} [[Quest point]] *{{SCP|Cooking|1,000}} [[Cooking]] experience *{{SCP|Farming|1,000}} [[Farming]] experience *{{SCP|Crafting|1,000}} [[Crafting]] experience *(Further) access to the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]]. |-| Pirate Pete= ''Items required: A weapon/food if low level, [[pestle and mortar]], a [[raw cod]], a [[knife]], a [[fishbowl]], a [[needle]], 3 [[bronze wire]] and [[bread]].'' {{Checklist| *Inspect Pirate Pete. *Talk to the cook in the next room about protecting the pirate. {{Chat option|3Protecting the Pirate}} *Go through all 5 chat options. {{Chat option|1Where do I get Ground Cod?|1Where do I get Ground Kelp?|2Where do I get Ground Giant Crab Meat?3|3Where do I get Breadcrumbs?|4What do I do with all of it?}} *Use your pestle and mortar on the raw cod. *Use your knife on the bread and make breadcrumbs. *Talk to [[Murphy]] in [[Port Khazard]]. {{Chat option|1Talk about Recipe for Disaster.}} *Talk to [[Murphy]] again. {{Chat option|1Yes, Let's go diving.}} }} '''''Note:''' Before diving your weight must be under 27 kg and you must have at least 7 free inventory spaces. You also cannot go underwater with a pet following you or in your inventory. You may also wish to acquire multiple ingredients in case the fishcake is burnt.'' {{Checklist| *Equip your fishbowl helmet and diving apparatus, agree to go diving.{{Chat option|1Talk about Recipe for Disaster.|1Yes, Let's go diving.}} *Pick some kelp. *Go north and talk to [[Nung]]. *Go west and pick up 5 [[Rock (Mogre Camp)|rocks]], then enter the cave. *Kill 5 [[mudskipper]]s (level 30/31) for 5 hides. *Talk to Nung twice. *Enter the crab pen, kill at least one crab and take its meat (acquire multiple in case the fishcake is burnt). *Use your pestle and mortar to grind the kelp and crab meat. *Talk to the Cook in Lumbridge about freeing the pirate again. {{Chat option|3Protecting the Pirate}} *Use the ingredients (ground cod, breadcrumbs, ground kelp and ground crab meat) on each other then cook the [[fishcake]]. *Give the fishcake to Pirate Pete in Lumbridge. }} ''Subquest complete!'' [[File:Recipe for Disaster (Freeing Pirate Pete) reward scroll.png|centre]] *{{SCP|Quest|1}} [[Quest point]] *{{SCP|Cooking|1,000}} [[Cooking]] experience *{{SCP|Crafting|1,000}} [[Crafting]] experience *{{SCP|Fishing|1,000}} [[Fishing]] experience *{{SCP|Smithing|1,000}} [[Smithing]] experience *The ability to go diving and fight [[crab]]s (you need your [[diving apparatus]]) *The ability to cook [[crab meat]] (heals 10 hitpoints in 5 bites) *The ability to kill crabs to get their shells and claws, which can be made into a [[Crab helmet|helmet]] and [[Crab claw|gloves]] with a [[chisel]] *(Further) access to the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]] |-| Lumbridge Guide= ''Items required: A [[bucket of milk]], an [[egg]], a [[pot of flour]], a [[cake tin]].''
''Completion of [[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]], [[Priest in Peril]], [[Biohazard]], [[Demon Slayer]], [[Nature Spirit]], [[The Restless Ghost]], [[Witch's House]], and [[Murder Mystery]].'' {{Checklist| *Inspect the Lumbridge Guide. {{Chat option|1Yes, I'm sure I can make a cake.}} *Talk to [[Traiborn|Wizard Traiborn]] on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of the [[Wizards' Tower]]. {{Chat option|1Ask about helping the Lumbridge Guide.}} *Talk to him again to enchant the egg by identifying 3 mystery NPCs. {{Chat option|1Ask about helping the Lumbridge Guide.|1Ok. Let's start!}} **Man with ponytail and book - Reldo **Ghostly green woman - Velorina **Man with desert robes and white beard - Ali Morrisane **Elf - Islwyn **Man with purple shirt - Unferth **Man with brown vest - Professor Gronigen **Woman with pink top - Gertrude **Woman (green witch) - Hetty **Man (hooded) - Pirate Pete **Man with a crown - King Lathas *Talk to him again to enchant the milk by answering trivia. {{Chat option|1Ask about helping the Lumbridge Guide.|1Ok. I'm ready!}} **Defence requirements to wear a Mystic hat - 20 **Ingredients in a cake - Flour, egg, milk **Combat level of Goblins near Lumbridge - 2 **GP to bribe an Al Kharid gate guard - 10 **What doesn't lie between Morytania and Asgarnia - Keep Le Faye **Gold ring is to 5 as a holy symbol is to - 16 **Glass vial is to 33 as a glass orb is to - 46 **Guild closest to Fishing Platform - Legends' **Bar west of Pollnivneach - Bandit Camp **The River Salve runs from - North to south **I can hear howling in one direction and buzzing in the other—where am I? - Catherby **If I'm going to need glass, first I will need - Sand, bucket, soda ash, glassblowing pipe **Which tower is closest to the Crafting Guild - Dark Wizards' Tower **Take the number of fire runes required to cast Fire Strike, and multiply by the number of air runes used to cast Wind Strike before adding the number of earth runes used to cast Earth Wave - 10 *Talk to him a third time to enchant the flour with a memory test. {{Chat option|1Ask about helping the Lumbridge Guide.|1Quiz me!}} *Take a screenshot of the items and then close the interface via the X button to answer the questions. *'''Do not use the ESC key''' to close the interface as it will reset that portion of the test! **Which item began with the letter 'm'? - [[Mind talisman|Mind Talisman]] **Which of the following items were NOT shown to you? - [[Trout]] **How many weapons were you shown? - Three ([[Maple longbow|Maple Longbow]], [[Magic shortbow|Magic Shortbow]] and [[Black longsword|Black Longsword]]) **How many types of rune were there? - Two ([[Fire rune|Fire Rune]] and [[Chaos rune|Chaos Rune]]) **Which items were amongst those you were shown? - [[Book of balance]] (noted as Guthix Prayer Book,) [[Magic logs|Magic Logs]], [[Pike]] *Use one of the ingredients on the cake tin, then cook the raw cake. *Give the cake of guidance to the Lumbridge guide. }} ''Subquest complete!'' [[File:Recipe for Disaster (Freeing the Lumbridge Guide) reward scroll.png|centre]] *{{SCP|Quest|1}} [[Quest point]] *{{SCP|Cooking|2,500}} [[Cooking]] experience *{{SCP|Magic|2,500}} [[Magic]] experience *(Further) access to the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]] |-| Evil Dave= ''Items required: A [[cat]] or [[wily cat]], 10+ [[Stew|stews]]. ''
''Completion of [[Shadow of the Storm]].'' {{Checklist| *Inspect [[Evil Dave]] *Talk to Evil Dave in [[Edgeville]] (down the trapdoor). {{Chat option|3What did you eat at the secret council meeting?|4You've got to tell me because the magic requires it!}} *Talk to [[Doris]] upstairs. *Use your cat to catch [[hell-rat]]s (right-click chase on your cat). Using a fully grown cat is much more efficient, but using a kitten still works. *Collect spices from hell-rats. There are 4 spices to collect: yellow, orange, red, brown. Collect at least 3 doses of each. *Now find the perfectly spiced stew with the right quantity of all 4 colours of spice. **Figure it out one colour at a time by adding different quantities of a colour and giving the stew to Evil Dave. When he says "…I think you've got the amount of one spice right…" you know the correct dose for that spice (be sure to finish the dialogue with Dave, otherwise you will not be able to give him the stew in Lumbridge). **Start by adding 1 dose of a colour to a stew, and if that isn't right add 2 doses of that colour to a stew; if 1 or 2 doses are not right, you know 3 doses is the correct dose for that colour. *Give Evil Dave the completed stew, then give him that spicy stew in Lumbridge. }} ''Subquest complete!'' [[File:Recipe for Disaster (Freeing Evil Dave) reward scroll.png|centre]] *{{SCP|Quest|1}} [[Quest point]] *{{SCP|Cooking|7,000}} [[Cooking]] experience *The ability to catch [[hellrat]]s to get a [[Hellcat]] *The ability to have your cat fight [[Hell-Rat Behemoth]]s *The ability to add coloured spices to [[stew]] by catching hellrats ([[Spicy stew]]s can boost and lower certain stats) *(Further) access to the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]] |-| Skrach Uglogwee= ''Items required: Any [[Log (disambiguation)|log]], any [[axe]], [[ball of wool]], any [[pickaxe]], 1+ [[raw chompy]], an [[iron spit]], a [[tinderbox]], [[ogre bellows]] and an [[ogre bow]] with [[Ogre arrow|ogre arrows]]. ''
''Completion of [[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]], 20 [[Firemaking]] and 41 [[Cooking]].'' {{Checklist| *Inspect Skrach Uglogwee. {{Chat option|1Yes, I'm sure I can get some Jubbly Chompy.|2Oh Ok then, I guess I'll talk to Rantz.}} *Talk to [[Rantz]] {{Chat option|2I'm trying to free Skrach, can you help?|3Ok, I'll do it.}}. (You can use the [[fairy ring]] code {{Fairycode|AKS}} and run east) *Go south-east and talk to Rantz by the coast. {{Chat option|2Ok, here I am...I guess this is the watery place? What now?}} *Use your woodcutting axe on the fallen tree '''twice'''. *Talk to him again. {{Chat option|2Ok, the boat's ready, now tell me how to get a Jubbly?}} *Get some raw chompies if needed. *Go to Karamja and find the tree with an arrow in it (small tree on the coast, just south of transportation icon west of [[Tai Bwo Wannai]]). **You can use the fairy ring code {{Fairycode|CKR}} and run north along the coast to the west to find it *Light a fire next to the tree, use your iron spit on a raw chompy, then cook it. *Board the ogre boat. {{Chat option|1}} *Talk to Rantz south-east near the coast. {{Chat option|2Ok, now tell me how to get Jubbly!}} *Collect a bloated toad from the nearby swamp. *Make sure your ogre bellow has at least 1 charge remaining *Get a rock from the mine by Rantz' cave. *Use the ogre bellows on the bloated toad for a balloon toad. *Drop the balloon toad and kill the [[Jubbly]] with ogre arrows. You may have to attempt multiple times. *Cook the Jubbly on Rantz's spit-roast. *Give the [[Cooked jubbly]] to Skrach Uglogwee in Lumbridge. }} ''Subquest complete!'' [[File:Recipe for Disaster (Freeing Skrach Uglogwee) reward scroll.png|centre]] *{{SCP|Quest|1}} [[Quest point]] *{{SCP|Woodcutting|1,500}} [[Woodcutting]] experience *{{SCP|Cooking|1,500}} [[Cooking]] experience *{{SCP|Crafting|1,500}} [[Crafting]] experience *{{SCP|Ranged|1,500}} [[Ranged]] experience *The ability to use the boat trip to travel between [[Karamja]] and the [[Feldip Hills]] (you must pay a fee of chompies or exotic herbs) *(Further) access to the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]] |-| Sir Amik Varze= ''Items required: A [[bucket of milk]], [[pot of cream]], a [[pot of cornflour]] (or an [[empty pot]] and a [[raw sweetcorn]]), a [[vanilla pod]] (obtainable during [[Legends' Quest]]), a [[dramen branch]], a [[dramen staff]], a [[pestle and mortar]], [[ice gloves]], a [[raw chicken]], combat equipment to kill a [[Black dragon]] and the [[Evil Chicken]]. ''
''Completion of [[Lost City]] and started [[Legends' Quest]].'' {{Checklist| *Inspect Sir Amik. *Ask the cook how you helped Sir Amik Varze. {{Chat option|4More...|5More...|2Protecting Sir Amik Varze}} *Use milk on cream. *If you need a pot of cornflour, grind raw sweetcorn in a [[windmill]] and fill a pot with it. *Add the pot of cornflour to the [[milky mixture]]. *Pick a vanilla pod in the [[Kharazi Jungle]] (SW of the pool used in [[Legends' Quest]]), add it to the cornflour mixture. *Talk to the [[Wise Old Man]] in Draynor, ask about strange beasts, then the Evil Chicken. {{Chat option|3I'd just like to ask you something.|2Strange beasts|5The Evil Chicken|2}} Make sure you finish the dialogue or you will not be able to proceed. {{Instance}} *Use a raw chicken on the Evil Chicken shrine in northern [[Zanaris]] (where you arrive from the swamp.) *Run north past the dragons and kill the [[Evil Chicken]], pick up its egg and add it to the brulee. *Kill a [[black dragon]], there is a safespot to the east, pick up the [[dragon token]]. *Grind a [[dramen branch]] with a pestle and mortar to make cinnamon, add it to the brulee. *Return to Zanaris through the southern portal. *Equip ice gloves then rub the token. {{Chat option|1Please flambe this creme brulee for me.}} *Give the [[Brulee supreme]] to Sir Amik in Lumbridge. }} ''Subquest complete!'' [[File:Recipe for Disaster (Freeing Sir Amik Varze) reward scroll.png|center]] *{{SCP|Quest|1}} [[Quest point]] *{{SCP|Cooking|4,000}} [[Cooking]] experience *{{SCP|Hitpoints|4,000}} [[Hitpoints]] experience *Access to the [[Evil Chicken's Lair]], where you can fight [[black dragon]]s (The [[Evil Chicken|fowl beast]] himself has moved on to other things.) *(Further) access to the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]] |-| Awowogei= ''Items required: [[M'speak amulet]], [[Ninja greegree|ninja]], [[Gorilla greegree|gorilla]] and [[Zombie greegree|zombie]] greegrees, 3010+ [[coins]], [[rope]], a [[knife]], a [[pestle and mortar]], a [[banana]] (obtainable on Ape Atoll), [[monkey nuts]] (obtainable on Ape Atoll), combat equipment (ranged weapon if you need to kill a [[Monkey Guard]]), and 3-9 free inventory spaces. ''
''Completion of [[Monkey Madness I]], 48 [[Agility]], 70 [[Cooking]]. ''
''Recommended: An [[Antipoison]].'' {{Checklist| *Inspect [[Awowogei]]. *Travel to Ape Atoll, equip a monkey greegree and M'speak amulet. *Talk to Awowogei south of the temple. *If you need a banana and monkey nuts, buy them from the food store now. *Talk to any of the 3 monkeys in the north-west corner of the temple. {{Chat option|3Do you know anything about the King's favourite dish?}} *Use your Banana and Monkey nuts on any of them. '''(Ensure you use both your Banana and Monkey nuts on them or else the Tchiki nuts will not appear on the bush.)''' *If you already have a gorilla, ninja, and zombie monkey greegree then skip this part. **Buy 3 blank monkey talismans from the rune store. **Kill a [[monkey archer]] in the market and take its bones. **Kill a [[Monkey Guard]] in the temple and take its bones. **Kill a [[zombie monkey]] under the temple and take its bones. **Bring the bones and talismans to Zooknock at the end of the [[Ape Atoll Dungeon]]. *'''''Note:''' You should take at least 3 snake corpses, red bananas, and tchiki nuts in case you burn the stuffed snake (use the drop trick for the nuts and the banana).'' *Travel to [[Crash Island]] and climb down the pit. Kill some level 84 [[big snake]]s for their [[Snake corpse|corpses]]. (Recommended to pray melee before descending into the pit) *Return to Ape Atoll and find the red banana tree north-west of the big gate (by the shore). *Equip your gorilla greegree and use a rope on the tree to get some [[red banana]]s. *Equip your ninja greegree and enter the [[Ape Atoll agility course]]. *After swinging the rope, enter the hole and pick some [[tchiki nut]]s. *Grind the tchiki nuts, slice the red banana, and add them to the snake corpses. *Equip your zombie greegree and enter the temple dungeon. *Go down one of the ramps and enter the crack in the wall between the two ramps. *Lay your stuffed snake on the rock to cook it (requires 70 cooking). *Give the cooked stuffed snake to Awowogei in Lumbridge. }} ''Subquest complete!'' [[File:Recipe for Disaster (Freeing King Awowogei) reward scroll.png|centre]] *{{SCP|Quest|1}} [[Quest point]] *{{SCP|Cooking|10,000}} [[Cooking]] experience *{{SCP|Agility|10,000}} [[Agility]] experience *[[Ape Atoll Teleport (standard)|Ape Atoll Teleport]] spell *(Further) access to the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]] ===The final battles=== {{Instance}} {{Checklist|*You will need 175 Quest Points and complete [[Desert Treasure]] before entering the portal. *Remember, you can bank between every kill. Enter the portal and defeat without prayers: **[[Agrith-Na-Na]] – Range or melee it, wear dragonhide. **[[Flambeed]] – Mage him with water spells + snare. He can unequip your weapon, unless you are wearing [[ice gloves]]. **[[Karamel]] – Mage her with fire while within melee distance or melee with crush. She will lower your stats frequently. '''Bring at least 2 restore potions. Or if going melee, use super combat potions''' **[[Dessourt]] – Mage (air spells or Iban blast) or range him. Snare will help. **[[Gelatinnoth Mother]] – Bring runes for all 4 elemental spells, a melee weapon, and a ranged weapon. Aim for high range defence without sacrificing too much magic attack. **[[Culinaromancer]] – Attack with whatever you can hit hardest with. Most of his damage comes from a magic attack that hits at a flat 1-in-3 rate, so your magic defence is irrelevant.}} ''Quest complete!'' ===Rewards=== {{Quest rewards page|Recipe for Disaster}} {{Recipe for Disaster}}
